# Rock-Breaking Cherry Tree

The ancient Rock-Splitting Cherry Tree in 2005
The  is an approximately 400-year-old cherry tree growing out of a crack in a granite boulder. It is located in front of the district courthouse in Morioka, the capital of Iwate Prefecture in the T≈çhoku region of northern Japan.
The tree measures 4.3 meters around the base, and is approximately 10 meters in height. It was proclaimed a Natural Treasure of Japan in 1923.
